alert.note: Alert for Glascock; Jefferson; Warren (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 26 at 9:58AM EDT by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Warren, Glascock and northern Jefferson Counties through 1030 AM EDT... At 958 AM EDT, a strong thunderstorm was near Gibson, moving east at 45 mph. HAZARD...40 to 50 mph wind, up to penny sized hail, frequent cloud to ground lightning and heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect minor damage to tree limbs and blowing around of light, unsecured objects. Heavy rain may cause temporary street flooding especially in poor drainage areas. Locations impacted include... Gibson, Wrens, Stapleton, Avera, Bastonville and Matthews. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: People outdoors should seek shelter immediately. If you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Motorists should slow down and be prepared for possible loss of control due to hydroplaning. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 100 PM EDT for east central Georgia.
